study_plan_entry.title: Scientific writing for biomedical articles - Advanced (b)

free_text.Content: [li] Conveying complex concepts or experimental results in a clear, concise manner[br/][li] Organization of research articles[br/][li] Writing for more specialized vs. more broad scientific readerships[br/][li] How to paragraph scientific articles correctly[br/][li] How to link ideas in a convincing manner[br/][li] Each participant will write a title, abstract, introduction which will be commented on by participants and trainer, either in small groups or in class. The emphasis is on structure and readability.[br/][li] The discussion section will be dealt with by commenting on  a published one. The trainer will edit the discussions of the students who have already  written one.[br/][li] On the 4th day each student will have individual coaching of 30 minutes on some writing of their own choice.[br/]
free_text.Required prior knowledge: PhD students who attended course a in 2011 and are at least in their 2nd year PhD. Those who did not attend course a in 2011 may exceptionally attend with the instructor's permission.[br/][br/]Important: Students who cannot attend all 4 sessions should enrol for the next course b.[br/]
